gameoflife

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameoflife.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game class is a Singleton that represents the running Game of Life. It is characterized by a given field, on which it can simulate steps of evolution.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void associateField(GameField field)
      Associates a new field to the game object.
      GameField getField()
      Return the internal field of the game instance.
      static Game getInstance()
      Returns the instance of the Game singleton.
      void next()
      Computes the next generation.
      void next(int steps)
      The method simulates a number of steps generations, through repeated calls of the next() method.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Returns the instance of the Game singleton.

        public void next()

      • next

        public void next(int steps)
        The method simulates a number of steps generations, through repeated calls of the next() method.
        Parameters:
        steps - number of generations to simulate

      • getField

        public GameField getField()
        Return the internal field of the game instance.
        Returns:
        game field on which the game object currently operates
